questions.text: The phenomenon shown by the graph below is-
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tracking of Blood Pressure The phenomenon depicted here is ‘Tracking of blood Pressure.’ If blood pressure levels of individuals were followed up over a period of years from early childhood into adulthood, then those whose BP was initially high in the distribution would probably continue on the same ‘track’ as adults. In other words, low blood pressure levels tend to remain low, and high levels tend to become higher as individuals grow older. This persistence phenomenon of blood pressure's rank order has been described as “tracking.”

questions.text: A 51-year-old man was diagnosed with small-cell lung cancer. The patient was a smoker with a > 40 pack-per-year history. Enforcement of The COTPA act is considered as which level of prevention?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Primary prevention The COTPA act enforces the following: Prohibition of smoking in public places; Prohibition of direct and indirect advertisement of cigarettes and other products; Prohibition of sale of cigarettes and other tobacco products to a person below the age of 18 years; Prohibition of sale of tobacco products near the educational institutions; Mandatory depiction of statutory warnings (including pictorial warnings) on tobacco packs; and Mandatory depiction of tar and nicotine contents along with maximum permissible limits on tobacco packs. All these are considered as primary preventive measures.

questions.text: In the OPD of your urban health and training centre, A 32-year-old male has a history of head reeling for a month. He is 1.64 m tall, and his weight is 92 kg. After your clinical examination, his BP was found to be 146/96 mm Hg. What would be your next line of action as per the guidelines from NPCDCS?

options.label: A
options.text: Test the blood sugar and all other relevant tests and confirm hypertension.

options.label: B
options.text: Immediately refer him to a higher center

options.label: C
options.text: Prescribe him to the anti-hypertensives immediately

options.label: D
options.text: Advice for weight reduction and lifestyle modification

questions.correct_answer: A. Test the blood sugar and all other relevant tests and confirm hypertension.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Test the blood sugar and all other relevant tests and confirm hypertension. Testing of blood sugar is a routine activity in any NCD clinic under the NPCDCS guidelines, and if a person above 30 years of age shows a Systolic BP of >140 and a diastolic BP of >90 mm Hg then the next step is to do blood sugar and other relevant tests after confirmation of hypertension. This should be followed up with at least one month's prescription and supply of the drugs, along with counseling that includes lifestyle modification and risk factors prevention and modification.
